intro: Eriostemon smithianus, commonly known as the Smith's eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is typically found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
